alert.note: Alert for East Glacier Park Region (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued February 03 at 2:27AM MST until February 04 at 5:00PM MST by NWS GreatFalls
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 5 PM THIS AFTERNOON TO 5 PM MST SATURDAY... * WHAT...Snow expected. Total snow accumulations up to 5 inches over Marias Pass. Wind gusts up to 75 mph are possible. Areas of blowing snow could greatly reduce visibility. * WHERE...East Glacier Park Region. * WHEN...From 5 PM this afternoon to 5 PM MST Saturday. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. Widespread blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Snow in excess of 6 inches is likely above pass level, especially north of Marias Pass.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. The latest road conditions can be obtained by calling 5 1 1 or visiting the MDT Road Report website. To see a graphical representation of the degree of stress on young livestock please visit our webpage and select Local Programs then Cold Air Advisory for Newborn Livestock.
